arm_group.description: Maggot therapy,ADMINISTERED TWO TIMES AS A NEW METHODS OF DRESSING in experimental group.conventional therapy ,administered two times in control group

brief_summary.textblock:
This study was a Kind of clinical trial with equal randomization, that have been done from
      January 2009 to June 2011 in the AFZALIPOOR hospital endocrine ward in Kerman-Iran on 128
      diabetic patient who had foot wounds.Replacement of conventional therapy by new methodes is
      one of the more important aims for health professional specially for nurses.One of this new
      treatment is maggot therapy.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of Maggot Therapy in Diabetic Foot Ulcers

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Have a chronic illness more than 7 weeks.

          -  The age of the patients between 40- 90 years old.

          -  Not having capillary disease (Blockage of artery, Rinold).

          -  Not user of anticoagulants and corticosteroids drugs.

          -  Patients without history of allergy to drugs and foods.

          -  Having diabetic type 2

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  patients who refer to critical clinical care unit

          -  patients who have amputation

intervention.description: each times in maggot therapy continued for three days.wound assessment was done before and after any intervention
patients receive ordinary treatment for diabetic foot

clinical_study.official_title: Maggot Therapy in Diabetic Foot Ulcers

primary_outcome.measure: change from baseline in BATES-JENSEN WOUND ASSESSMENT score at 3days and change from baseline in BATES-JENSEN WOUND ASSESSMENT score at 6 days

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Treatment
